title: Cadbury's Freddo bars price to go up to 30p and chocolate fans are not happy!
text:
What's On Cadbury's Freddo bars price to go up to 30p and chocolate fans are not happy! In the wake of Monster Munch gate comes another revelation regarding a childhood favourite - get ready to vent! Share Get what's on updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Still getting your head round the revelation that Monster Munch might not be claw shaped ? Well brace yourself as we have some distressing news regarding another childhood favourite...Freddos are going up to an astonishing 30p! 
The budget Cadbury’s treat, often stocked alongside Taz bars (what became of them?!) used to be 10p and then 15p but at the most recent check were on sale for 25p. 
Well if you thought that was a bit steep you’re in for a shock as the 18g chocolate bar is now going up to 30p. 
The price hike from Cadbury owner Mondelez comes a few months after the company increased the gap between Toblerone peaks to reduce the weight. Read More Monster Munch debate: Walkers give a definitive answer to crisp quandary 
A spokesman blamed the rising cost of commodities including cocoa, along with foreign exchange pressures. 
The US food manufacturing giant said it was having to make selective price increases as a “last resort”. 
But it’s a last resort that hasn’t gone down well on social media. 
Tweeting his outrage at the increase, Chris Smith blamed Brexit, posting: “Freddo bars going up to 30p. I hope Leavers are happy with what they’ve done to this country,” while Lewys Simpson Jones wrote “OK it’s official ... the #uksnow #uk situation just got serious ... #freddo bars are now 30p,” and SpruceNews vented: “I’ve just read that @CadburyUK Freddo chocolate bars are going to sold for 30p each!! & WHAT??? That’s ridiculous! #SaveTheFreddo” poll loading
